body:
r=me in the sense that the code does what it says.

One question: AIUI this would allow one recipe to clear storage that affects another recipe. I'm... not sure that's always going to be a good idea - other recipes might not expect their stuff to get cleared in the middle of what they were doing... Why do we need it? Or am I misunderstanding whether we use the prefixes to separate different recipes?

> Should we be flagging you or another peer here on Github when we make changes to the add-on? If you r+ something on Github, is @mythmon clear to commit to mozilla-central (assuming a try push passes, or whatever other steps are involved with filing a bug and merging that I'm not aware of)

I think so. Doesn't really matter if the r+ was on github or bugzilla. It might be quicker if I look at things as they (individually) get developed (ie on github) rather than doing some kind of per-version batch merge where there'll be a bunch of unrelated changes that I have to separate again in order to make sense of what the m-c merge is doing. :-)

If it's any help, for readability (reader mode), we effectively review and merge on github, and occasionally I or other people update the m-c repo copy manually (usually landing with r=me because there are usually several commits from github in the single m-c merge). So that would be a similar system, AIUI.
